text: TRAILERS by December 9, 2024Source: YouTube "Immortality is what you dream of..." Crunchyroll has revealed a second teaser trailer for Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - Infinity Castle, the first in a trilogy of anime spin-off films continuing the Demon Slayer stories. This first one is already set for a theatrical release in the US starting in 2025 - no final date has been announced. This latest teaser trailer (the second one so far) comes from the CCXP event in Brazil. The Demon Slayer Corps plunge into Infinity Castle to defeat Muzan. However, the remaining Hashiras and the Demon Slayers who survived Tanjiro's Final Selection are pitted against the remaining members of the Twelve Kizuki first. A sequel film set after the events of the first season, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Mugen Train, was released in October 2020, while films, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – To the Swordsmith Village and Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – To the Hashira Training, were respectively released in February 2023 & February 2024. It was such a success they'll continue with a theatrical release of this next one. Featuring the voices of Natsuki Hanae, Yoshitsugu Matsuoka, Hiro Shimono, and Akari Kitô. It'll be released in 2025 both with English dub & subtitles. Check out the latest footage below. Two teaser trailers for Crunchyroll's Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle, via YouTube: A film trilogy adapting the iconic manga's "Infinity Castle" story arc is ready to premiere in 2025. The Demon Slayer Corps plunge into Infinity Castle to defeat Muzan. However, the remaining Hashiras and the Demon Slayers who survived Tanjiro's Final Selection are pitted against the remaining members of the Twelve Kizuki first. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle, also known as 鬼滅の刃 in Japanese, is directed by Japanese anime filmmaker Haruo Sotozaki, an animator / storyboard artist, also director of "Tales of Zestiria the X" and the entire Demon Slayer series of films and TV shows previously. The film features Akira Matsushima as Chief Animation Director and Character Designer, and music by Yuki Kajiura and Go Shiina. Animated by Ufotable. Produced by Aniplex, Crunchyroll, Shueisha, and Sony Pictures. The first movie Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle will arrive in US theaters sometime in 2025 - stay tuned for the exact release date. For more info visit the anime's official site. Source: YouTube

"Immortality is what you dream of..." Crunchyroll has revealed a second teaser trailer for Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - Infinity Castle, the first in a trilogy of anime spin-off films continuing the Demon Slayer stories. This first one is already set for a theatrical release in the US starting in 2025 - no final date has been announced. This latest teaser trailer (the second one so far) comes from the CCXP event in Brazil. The Demon Slayer Corps plunge into Infinity Castle to defeat Muzan. However, the remaining Hashiras and the Demon Slayers who survived Tanjiro's Final Selection are pitted against the remaining members of the Twelve Kizuki first. A sequel film set after the events of the first season, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Mugen Train, was released in October 2020, while films, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – To the Swordsmith Village and Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – To the Hashira Training, were respectively released in February 2023 & February 2024. It was such a success they'll continue with a theatrical release of this next one. Featuring the voices of Natsuki Hanae, Yoshitsugu Matsuoka, Hiro Shimono, and Akari Kitô. It'll be released in 2025 both with English dub & subtitles. Check out the latest footage below.

Two teaser trailers for Crunchyroll's Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle, via YouTube:

A film trilogy adapting the iconic manga's "Infinity Castle" story arc is ready to premiere in 2025. The Demon Slayer Corps plunge into Infinity Castle to defeat Muzan. However, the remaining Hashiras and the Demon Slayers who survived Tanjiro's Final Selection are pitted against the remaining members of the Twelve Kizuki first. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle, also known as 鬼滅の刃 in Japanese, is directed by Japanese anime filmmaker Haruo Sotozaki, an animator / storyboard artist, also director of "Tales of Zestiria the X" and the entire Demon Slayer series of films and TV shows previously. The film features Akira Matsushima as Chief Animation Director and Character Designer, and music by Yuki Kajiura and Go Shiina. Animated by Ufotable. Produced by Aniplex, Crunchyroll, Shueisha, and Sony Pictures. The first movie Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle will arrive in US theaters sometime in 2025 - stay tuned for the exact release date. For more info visit the anime's official site.
